title: Harvey Weinstein loses bid to have criminal trial moved out of NYC
text:
Harvey Weinstein lost his bid to have his criminal case moved out of Manhattan.

The Appellate Division of the Supreme Court for the First Judicial Department in the County of New York handed down their decision on Thursday in what was likely Weinstein's last bid to delay the proceedings.

'Defendant having moved ... for a change of venue, and ... for a stay of trial,' read the court's decision.

'Now, upon reading and filing the papers with respect to the motion, and due deliberation having been had thereon, It is ordered that the motion is denied in its entirety.'

Last chance Harvey: An appeals court denied Harvey Weinstein's motion to stay his trial and have it moved out of New York City (Weinstein above in July)

Assistant District Attorney Harriet Galvin had objected to Weinstein's attempt at a change of venue in a searing response that was filed in August.

She wrote that 'from the beginning, the defendant’s lawyers have contributed to the media coverage they now complain about by making extrajudicial statements about the case, portraying the defendant as a scapegoat who has been targeted by the “Me Too” movement, thus employing the well-worn strategy of trying his case outside of the courtroom.'

She went on to state that 'because (1) defendant’s allegations are unfounded and (2) the trial court can ensure the selection of a fair and impartial jury, defendant’s motion should be denied and his case should go forward according to the schedule previously set by the court and the parties.'

Galvin also went after Weinstein's latest addition to the defense team, saying that it was those lawyers keeping the story in the press.

'For example, on July 11, 2019, Donna Rotunno, Esq., a member of defendant’s current defense team, upon leaving the courthouse, told reporters that while other lawyers had come before her in this case, being a woman helped make her a good fit for the defendant and that jurors would find it more effective to have a woman questioning another woman on the witness stand ("We will hear the other side of this story . . . we came here to win"),' wrote Galvin.

'In another interview, on June 27, 2019, Ms. Rotunno stated that she "has never subscribed" to the "MeToo" movement and that by representing the defendant, she hoped to encourage women to take responsibility for their actions ("Maybe don’t go to the hotel room").'

The trial is set to start in January.
description: Harvey Weinstein lost his bid to have his criminal case moved out of Manhattan. The Appellate Division of the Supreme Court for the First Judicial Department in the County of New York ruled.
